Line 17: Line 17:
'''LinuxForums.org''' is a community-driven website owned by Core Root for Linux users needing free help and support with their Linux distributions and software, and computer hardware. With more than 150,000 registered members <ref>[http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/ 150,000 Registered Users!]</ref>, it is one of the most active Linux forums and [[free software community]] sites on the Internet.
'''LinuxForums.org''' is a community-driven website owned by Core Root for Linux users needing free help and support with their Linux distributions and software, and computer hardware. With more than 150,000 registered members <ref>[http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/ 150,000 Registered Users!]</ref>, it is one of the most active Linux forums and [[free software community]] sites on the Internet.
â
Support is given in different ways in specific forums, such as on a [[linux distribution|distribution]] level (for major distribution such as [[Red Hat]]/[[Fedora Core]], [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], [[Suse]], [[Slackware]], [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]), but also on an operational level (for areas such as [[Wireless network|Wireless]], [[Computer Programs|Applications]], [[Server (computing)|Server]]s, [[Computer network|Networking]], [[Desktop environment|Desktop]] / [[X Window System|X Window]], [[Programming]] & [[Scripting]]).
+
Support is given in different ways in specific forums, such as on a [[linux distribution|distribution]] level (for major distribution such as [[Red Hat]]/[[Fedora Core]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Suse]], [[Slackware]], [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]), but also on an operational level (for areas such as [[Wireless network|Wireless]], [[Computer Programs|Applications]], [[Server (computing)|Server]]s, [[Computer network|Networking]], [[Desktop environment|Desktop]] / [[X Window System|X Window]], [[Programming]] & [[Scripting]]).
In [[December]], [[2005]] the forum changed ownership and changed the forum software from [[phpBB]] to [[vBulletin]] along with a complete overhaul of the remainder of the site.<ref>[http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/linux-forums-site-news/50944-linux-forums-new-management.html Linux Forums - New Management]</ref>
In [[December]], [[2005]] the forum changed ownership and changed the forum software from [[phpBB]] to [[vBulletin]] along with a complete overhaul of the remainder of the site.<ref>[http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/linux-forums-site-news/50944-linux-forums-new-management.html Linux Forums - New Management]</ref>
